text: Herry Saliku Biembe (born May 14, 1981) is the best boxer from Democratic Republic of the Congo who qualified for the 2008 Olympics at middleweight. At the 2nd AIBA African 2008 Olympic Qualifying Tournament the previously unknown Biembe won second place, even though he was shut out in the final by Badou Jack of Gambia. In the Olympics, he lost his opening bout to Georgios Gazis of Greece and was eliminated. ==External links== *2nd Qualifier *Herry Saliku Biembe's profile at NBC Olympics * Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Kinshasa Category:Middleweight boxers Category:Boxers at the 2008 Summer Olympics Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo male boxers Category:Olympic boxers of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
title: Herry Saliku Biembe
